block.p: Eliza Ridgely Sorensen, a daughter of Leigh and Arthur Sorensen of Rumson, N.J., was married there yesterday to Zachary O Wald, a son of Ellen Wald Ginsberg of Sands Point, N.Y., and the late Richard I. Wald. The Rev. Bethany Nourse Golden, a Unitarian Universalist minister, officiated.

The bride, 25, and bridegroom, 26, graduated from Brown University, where they met. They live in California, where she teaches the first grade at the Stege Elementary School in Richmond and he is developing a master plan for pedestrians for the city of Oakland.

Eliza Ridgely Sorensen, a daughter of Leigh and Arthur Sorensen of Rumson, N.J., was married there yesterday to Zachary O Wald, a son of Ellen Wald Ginsberg of Sands Point, N.Y., and the late Richard I. Wald. The Rev. Bethany Nourse Golden, a Unitarian Universalist minister, officiated.

The bride, 25, and bridegroom, 26, graduated from Brown University, where they met. They live in California, where she teaches the first grade at the Stege Elementary School in Richmond and he is developing a master plan for pedestrians for the city of Oakland.

The bride, who is keeping her name, also graduated from New College in San Francisco, where she received her teaching credential. Her father, a lawyer, practices in Atlantic Highlands, N.J. Her mother is a landscape designer in Rumson.

The bridegroom is the founder and executive director of the Bay Area Pedestrian Education Group, a nonprofit organization that promotes pedestrian safety in Oakland. He received a master's degree in city and regional planning from the University of California at Berkeley. His mother and stepfather, Mark Ginsberg, are partners in a real estate management company bearing their names in Sands Point. His father was a partner in Tart & Wald, a former New York law firm.
